Body:
Description: Hello,

We just noticed what appears to be an issue with how the AIC is displaying Activity Events. It used to be it would show the names of the users, but now it only shows the SID of the user.

Almost always due to ADI not properly running. I would check there first.

If ADI is running and appears successful. Look at a sid in the AIC and look to see if it exists in the ADI Users View.

Also confirm if multiple domains and if so confirm that is successfully running

If ADI isn't running handle that.

If its running and exists in the view. May have to run a full ADI scan to correct the issue then Run a diff and review the AIC

Then last resort probably remove adi tables and run a full scan again.

Â
Invitation updated. Attendees: Frantz Baptiste, Peter Sterianos
Invitation updated. Attendees: No attendees listed
What We've Learned Updated: The customer was looking for information on the Azure domain, but he's not licensed for Azure.

Steps to Reproduce Updated: Log in to AIC
Click on Resource Audit
Expand SharePoint
Look for Activity Details

Steps to Reproduce Updated: Log in to AIC
Click on Resource Audit
Expand SharePoint
Look for Activity Details
I explained to the customer that he needed an Azure license to retrieve details about the user's login information.
